name: inexpedience
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of not being helpful or useful in a particular situation: We are all in agreement about the inexpedience of continuing with the existing system. My father warned me of the inexpedience of pruning roses during the winter.
More examplesFewer examplesHe believed in the traditional ways of doing things and could not be convinced of their inexpedience.The minister was concerned about the political inexpedience of sending in troops to arrest the demonstrators.The inexpedience of economic inflation is undeniable.
